it.unibo.alchemist.model.implementations.reactions

Class AReaction<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unibo.alchemist.model.implementations.reactions.AReaction<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type which describes the concentration of a molecule This class offers a partial implementation of IReaction. In particular, it allows to write new reaction specifying only which distribution time to adopt
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IReaction<T>, Serializable, Comparable<IReaction<T>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChemicalReaction, Event, SAPEREGradient, SAPEREReaction

    public abstract class AReaction<T>
extends Object
implements IReaction<T>
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • cloneConditionsAndActions

        protected static <T> void cloneConditionsAndActions(List<? extends ICondition<T>> conditions,
                                                    List<? extends IAction<T>> actions,
                                                    IReaction<T> res)
        This method provides facility to clone reactions. Given a new reaction where to clone and two sets of actions and conditions, it initializes the given reaction. The current time of occurrence and the target node are asserted by retrieving them from the passed reaction, so initialize it carefully. It is useful in the implementation of the cloneOnNewNode method.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type which describes the concentration of a molecule
        Parameters:
        conditions - the list of conditions to clone on the passed reaction
        actions - the list of actions to clone on the passed reaction
        res - the target reaction

      • update

        public final void update(ITime curTime,
                         boolean executed,
                         IEnvironment<T> env)
        Description copied from interface: IReaction
        Updates the times of this reaction.
        Specified by:
        update in interface IReaction<T>
        Parameters:
        curTime - the current time of execution. This is mandatory in order to correctly compute the time shift of an already-scheduled reaction
        executed - true if the reaction have just been executed.
        env - the current environment

      • getActions

        public List<? extends IAction<T>> getActions()
        Specified by:
        getActions in interface IReaction<T>
        Returns:
        The list of the actions of the IReaction. There is no specification if the list will be a copy of the internal list or a reference. It will depend on implementations. Please be careful when you modify this list.

      • getConditions

        public List<? extends ICondition<T>> getConditions()
        Specified by:
        getConditions in interface IReaction<T>
        Returns:
        The list of the conditions of the IReaction. There is no specification if the list will be a copy of the internal list or a reference. It will depend on implementations. Please be careful when you modify this list.

      • getInfluencedMolecules

        public List<? extends IMolecule> getInfluencedMolecules()
        Specified by:
        getInfluencedMolecules in interface IReaction<T>
        Returns:
        The list of molecules whose concentration may change after the execution of this reaction. If it returns null, it means that it will influence every other reaction with compatible context, regardless the molecules involved.

      • getInfluencingMolecules

        public List<? extends IMolecule> getInfluencingMolecules()
        Specified by:
        getInfluencingMolecules in interface IReaction<T>
        Returns:
        The list of the molecules whose concentration may affect the execution of the reaction. If it returns null, it means that it is influenced every other reaction with compatible context, regardless the molecules involved.

      • getNode

        public INode<T> getNode()
        Specified by:
        getNode in interface IReaction<T>
        Returns:
        The node in which this reaction acts.
